text:
Question 30) Kingle in myself I see each other and another and another make dozens trains passing wagons full of people hundreds the other that is in me are you and you as I am in you I am in it in us and only when we are in We are at peace even if we are alone Leminski, P. All poetry. Sao Paulo: Cia. das Letras, 2013.
The search for identity is a facet of the literary tradition, resized by the contemporary look. In the poem, this new dimension reveals the
A) Absence of identity traits.
B) Anguish with solitude in public.
C) appreciation of the discovery of the authentic “self”.
D) Perception of empathy as a factor of self -knowledge.
E) Impossibility to experience experiences of belonging.
